description: After listening to testimony at the mural assemblies, Rada Miskovic decides the city needs the full truth. She prepares instructions for safely releasing the BCI archives, coordinating with trusted assembly leaders.
With quiet backing from Oksana Lintz, Rada initiates the release of the full BCI historical database. Assembly tech teams set up open-access terminals near the mural for public review.

News spreads that citizens can now audit their own and others' BCI histories at the mural site. Large crowds gather, and spontaneous testimonials reveal hidden abuses and rare acts of compassion buried in the data.

A "truth council" forms at the mural, inviting residents to cross-check cases and demand accountability. Directorate officials attempt to cordon off the area, but are met by peaceful resistance and viral live-streams.

As the Directorate intensifies efforts to reclaim narrative control, public standoffs grow. With Council authority faltering, civic debates erupt citywide, and the Council is forced to suspend the BCI until new terms of governance can be negotiated.
